Articles.Content:
Hi everybody,

Here's the situation:

- 2 ships with a pair of docking ports facing each other

- 1 pair is used to dock with each other

- The other pair incidentally faces each other and can be connected/docked

Now my question is ="> can I connect the other pair of docking ports with each other even though the 2 original ships are already docked? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Just wanted to find out if this is possible to further strengthen structural integrity when constructing big "things" in orbit/space. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Regards and thanks in advance,

Vist =)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-24T05:23:16Z" title="07/24/2015 05:23  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 24, 2015</time> by Vist**

Yes, multi-port connections are possible. They are tricky though, because you need to have the ports connect at the same time.

I think Whackjob once did 18-port docking.

[/PossibleFisherman'sTale]
It is possible, but you're better off using Kerbal Attachment System's struts to do the same thing.

> 
> Yes, multi-port connections are possible. They are tricky though, because you need to have the ports connect at the same time.
> I think Whackjob once did 18-port docking.
> 
> [/PossibleFisherman'sTale]

18 port docking???? am still trying to get a handle of it with just 1 ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) :"> "unassisted" 

> 
> It is possible, but you're better off using Kerbal Attachment System's struts to do the same thing.

Yeah, that looks like the way to do it at the moment. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) But it does add to the total part count though. :">

Believe it or not, multi-port docking was the only way to build larger ships back in the day. When the devs first implemented docking, there was only the 1 meter and .625 meter docking ports. Anything bigger, and you had to do a multiport dock using those awful tri-adaptors. Whackjob needed to do this a lot, because he's Whackjob. He tended to work on a larger scale than the rest of us...

> 
> Believe it or not, multi-port docking was the only way to build larger ships back in the day. When the devs first implemented docking, there was only the 1 meter and .625 meter docking ports. Anything bigger, and you had to do a multiport dock using those awful tri-adaptors. Whackjob needed to do this a lot, because he's Whackjob. He tended to work on a larger scale than the rest of us...

Wow, honestly didn't know it was like that before 1.0 :">

Mutiport connection are possible, but they require exacting placement, which is why is best to use bi/tri/quad-couplers to make sure the docking ports are always equidistant on any spaceship you build. I still use tri-docks even though I have the large docking port so that all my new ships will be compatible with my old ones. The station on the right is in fact two separate pieces tri-docked together, designed back when I had a 140t launch limit. The plus side, the connection is secure, the downside, the front end of your spaceships will look like electric razors.

![FE6GEUal.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/FE6GEUal.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-24T07:21:58Z" title="07/24/2015 07:21  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 24, 2015</time> by Edax**
I tried this precisely once. For a much better modded solution, load up Kerbal Joint Reinforcement (for a strong connection) and SpaceY, which includes 3.75m and 5m docking ports.

Was testing some designs for stability in LKO with between two ships using docking port sr's.

![U5nxUtV.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/U5nxUtV.jpg)

legend:

rectangular boxes - docking port sr.

I docked using the upper pair of ports then decided to re-dock with the lower pair ports. Somehow, both pairs became docked to my surprise. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Tried to recreate it but couldn't do it again after a few tries, it was getting really late and I had work the following day. :">

Has anyone experienced this? Hoping this is possible and not just some fluke my noob self did ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
